title: Wae Rebo
content: Covered by thin mist all over the village, Wae Rebo in Flores, East Nusa Tenggara is deservingly holding the title "the town above the clouds". Reach this truly fascinating traditional village from Labuan Bajo Airport through Ruteng City and then proceed to Denge Village before trekking for 4 hours to Wae Rebo. ğŸ“¸: @backpackertampan #WaeRebo #EastNusaTenggara #Indonesia #Travel #WonderfulIndonesia

title: Kelimutu
content: Literally translated as "the boiling lake", Kelimutu has three craters that apparently change colors and alternating between green, red, and blue which always independent of one another. Located in Flores, East Nusa Tenggara, you can take public transportation from Moni, the closest small town, to get to the parking lot before Kelimutuâ€™s peak. From there, hike to see the otherworldly spectacle from the top of the world. ğŸ“·: @thefreedomcomplex #Kelimutu #EastNusaTenggara #Indonesia #Travel #WonderfulIndonesia

title: Mount Bromo
content: Stood over 2,329 meters above the sea level and situated 35 kilometers away from the city of Malang, Mount Bromo might not be the tallest mountain in the entire Java, but it sure delivers an otherworldly spectacle. Climbing to the summit takes about 20-30 minutes depending on how quickly you can haul yourself up the sandy slope. Dare to try the challenging experience? title: Komodo Island
content:
Immerse yourself in the wonders of nature at Komodo Island.

Gaze upon the unique blush sands of the Pink Beach and watch as nimble deer dart into the azure sea, a dramatic escape from the island's resident Komodo dragons.

It's a spectacle of survival and beauty, intertwining to create a moment that stays with you long after your footprints fade from the pink sand.

title: Misool Raja Ampat
content:
Experience serene island living at Yapap Homestay, nestled over the tranquil waters of Misool, Raja Ampat.

Accessible by a twice-weekly overnight ferry from Sorong, followed by a local boat ride, this secluded paradise offers the ultimate retreat. Wake up to the soothing sound of waves and panoramic views of the ocean right from your overwater bungalow. There's truly no better way to immerse yourself in Indonesia's stunning natural beauty. ğŸš¤ğŸï¸

Did you know that Raja Ampat has been officially designated as one of the UNESCO Global Geoparks
